title: The making of FF Meta Serif
content: People interested in the background story of the development of [FF Meta Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018114806/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FF%20Meta%20Serif) can read about it on [Unzipped](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018114806/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=239). I was really fortunate to be able to talk to all three designers, receiving production drawings _and_ transcripts of e-mail communications.
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content: Very interesting, Yves. As for the resulting typeface, it looks a bit like Friedrich Poppl's Poppl Pontifex, don't you think ?

I noticed some similarities with Frutiger's Egyptienne F. And Jean François saw some Renault in there. Read his remarks on [his blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018114806/http:/www.porchez.com/article/407/meta-serif-is-less-unique).
You are very welcome -- I hope you enjoy the article. Thanks to the materials I received it has become a rare view into the working process of a type design collaboration.
